t: Volatile Organic Compounds' Impact on Indoor Air Quality | US EPA
s: August 13, 2024 - Volatile organic compounds (VOCs) are emitted as gases from certain solids or liquids. VOCs include a variety of chemicals, some of which may have short- and long-term adverse health effects. Concentrations of many VOCs are consistently higher indoors (up to ten times higher) than outdoors.

t: What are volatile organic compounds (VOCs)? | US EPA
s: February 24, 2025 - Volatile organic compounds are compounds that have a high vapor pressure and low water solubility. Many VOCs are human-made chemicals that are used and produced in the manufacture of paints, pharmaceuticals, and refrigerants. VOCs typically are industrial

t: Volatile Organic Compounds | American Lung Association
s: Volatile organic compounds, or VOCs, are gases that are emitted into the air from products or processes.

t: Volatile organic compounds (VOCs) | Minnesota Pollution Control Agency
s: Volatile organic compounds (VOCs) are a group of chemicals that can vaporize into air. VOCs are in thousands of daily use products, including paint, varnish, wax, and various cleaning, degreasing, and cosmetic products.
